title: Psychedelic drug
summary: Psychedelics are a class of hallucinogenic drugs whose primary effect is to trigger non-ordinary states of consciousness (known as psychedelic experiences or "trips") via serotonin 2A receptor agonism.[2][3][4] This causes specific psychological, visual and auditory changes, and often a substantially altered state of consciousness.[5][6][3][7] The "classical" psychedelics, the psychedelics with the largest scientific and cultural influence, are mescaline, LSD, psilocybin, and DMT.[8][9][10][11]
